lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Grimm.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Grimm.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

* A launcher class to workaround classpath issues.
* The main class that runs the Grimm application.
* The Grimm class is responsible for handling the user input, processing commands, and managing tasks.
* It interacts with various components such as the TaskList, Ui, and Storage to perform actions on tasks,
* such as adding, marking, unmarking, deleting, and displaying tasks.
* Loads tasks from the default storage file into the task list.
* Attempts to read tasks from the file located at "./data/grimm.txt" using the Storage class.
* Each loaded task is added to the internal task list.
* In case the file is not found or a Grimm-specific exception occurs,
* appropriate UI error messages are displayed.
* Modifies a task in the task list based on the specified command.
* Parses the task index from the parser description, validates the index,
* and performs the requested operation: mark, unmark, or delete.
* Returns an appropriate UI message based on the operation result.
* If the command is unrecognized or an error occurs, the method returns
* a corresponding UI error or unknown command message.
* @param parser  The Parser object containing the user input and task index description.
* @param command The Command enum indicating the modification operation to perform.
* @return A string message generated by the UI reflecting the outcome of the operation.
private String modifyTasks(Parser parser, Command command) {

* The main method that runs the Grimm application.
* This method initializes the application, loads tasks from a storage file,
* and listens for user commands to interact with the task list. It also handles
* saving the tasks back to the file upon exiting the application.
* @param args The command-line arguments passed to the application.
* A GUI for Grimm using FXML.
* Represents a Deadline task with a due date.
* The Deadline has a description and a due date. It extends the Task class.
* Functionality to format and display due dates.
private static final DateTimeFormatter OUTPUT_FORMAT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("d MMMM yyyy", Locale.forLanguageTag("en-SG"));
* Constructs a Deadline task with a given description and due date.
*     The deadline task will be unmarked.
* @param name The description of the task.
* @param dueDate The due date of the task in "MM/dd/yyyy" format.
* Constructs a Deadline task with a given description, a mark status, and a due date.
* @param name     The description of the task.
* @param mark     The mark status of the task (true if marked, false if unmarked).
* @param dueDate  The due date of the task in "MM/dd/yyyy" format.
public Deadline(String name, boolean mark, String dueDate) {
* Formats the due date from "MM/dd/yyyy" to "d MMMM yyyy" in Singapore time.
* If the due date is invalid, it returns the original string.
* @return The formatted due date, or the original string if parsing fails.
* Represents an Event task with a start and end date.
* The Event has a description, start date and end date. It extends the Task class.
* Functionality to format and display start date and end date.
private static final DateTimeFormatter INPUT_FORMAT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MM/dd/yyyy HHmm");
private static final DateTimeFormatter OUTPUT_FORMAT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("d MMMM yyyy, h:mm a").withLocale(Locale.forLanguageTag("en-SG"));
* Constructs an Event task with a given description, start date, and end date.
* @param name      The description of the event.
* @param startDate The start date of the event in "MM/dd/yyyy HHmm" format.
* @param endDate   The end date of the event in "MM/dd/yyyy HHmm" format.
public Event(String name, String startDate, String endDate) {
* Constructs an Event task with a given description, mark status, start date, and end date.
* @param name      The description of the event.
* @param mark      The mark status of the event (true if marked, false if unmarked).
* @param startDate The start date of the event in "MM/dd/yyyy HHmm" format.
* @param endDate   The end date of the event in "MM/dd/yyyy HHmm" format.
public Event(String name, boolean mark, String startDate, String endDate) {
* Formats the start and end dates of the event from "MM/dd/yyyy HHmm" to "d MMMM yyyy, h:mm a".
* If the date format is invalid, it returns the raw start and end dates.
* @return A formatted string with the event's start and end date-times, or the original string if parsing fails.
* Represents a generic task with a description and a mark status.
* The task has a description and can be marked as completed or unmarked. It can be used as the base class
* for more specific task types, such as ToDo, Deadline, and Event.
* Constructs a Task with a given description.
* @param name The description of the task.
* Constructs a Task with a given description and mark status.
* If the mark parameter is true, the task will be marked as completed.
* @param name The description of the task.
* @param isMarked The initial mark status of the task (true for marked, false for unmarked).
* The TaskList class manages a collection of tasks and provides functionality
* for adding, marking, unmarking, deleting tasks, and checking for out-of-bounds indices.
private final List<Task> taskList = new ArrayList<>();

* The ToDo class extends the Task class and represents a simple task
* that can be marked or unmarked.
* It has a description and has its own string representation.
* Constructs a ToDo task with a given description.
* @param name The description of the ToDo task.
* Constructs a ToDo task with a given description and mark status.
* @param name The description of the ToDo task.
* @param mark The initial mark status of the task (true for marked, false for unmarked).
* Represents a command in the Grimm application.
* The Command enum encapsulates various commands such as "bye", "list", "mark",
* by a string value and the enum provides functionality to validate commands and
* convert input strings into Command objects.
* Constructs a Command object with the specified command string.
* If the provided command is null, it will be initialized to an unknown command.
* @param command The command string to initialize the Command object with.
* Converts a string input into a corresponding Command enum.
* This method matches the input string with one of the predefined
* commands in the enum. If no match is found, it returns UNKNOWN.
* @param input The string input to be converted into a Command.
* @return The corresponding Command enum, or UNKNOWN if no match is found.
* Parses and validates user input commands for the Grimm task management system.
* The Parser class interprets user commands, validate the task descriptions,
* and ensure that the input follows the correct format.
* Provides utility methods to process specific task types.
* Initializes an empty parser with no command and description.
* Constructs a Parser with a given command and description.
* @param command The command to be parsed.
* @param desc    The description for the task associated with the command.
* Parses the user input into a Command and its description.
* Splits the input into the command and the description. The command is validated and converted
* into a Command object. If the input is empty, an "UNKNOWN" command is created.
* @param input The user input to parse.
* @return A new Parser object with the parsed command and description.
* @throws GrimmException if the input is invalid or empty.
throw new GrimmException("A task with no name? Try again with a description.");
private void checkValidFormat(String[] input, int length, String msg) throws GrimmException {
public void checkValidDeadlineFormat(String[] input) throws GrimmException {

public void checkValidEventFormat(String[] input) throws GrimmException {
checkValidFormat(input, 2, "An event with no start and end? Try again with: event <desc> /from <time> /to <time>.");
public void checkValidUpdateFormat(String[] input) throws GrimmException {
checkValidFormat(input, 3, "The troupe cannot update this. Try again with: update <num> <task type> <new desc>.");
* Attempts to parse the description as an integer.

throw new GrimmException("This is not a number I know. Try again.");

* Parses the event description and returns the description, start date, and end date.

assert descParts.length == 2 : "Event should be split into desc and time";

* Handles reading and writing tasks from and to a file.
* The Storage class provides methods to load tasks from a file and save tasks to a file.
* Process tasks to and from their respective string representations.
* It handles various types of tasks, including ToDo, Deadline, and Event.
* Constructs a Storage object with the specified file path.
* @param path The path to the file where tasks will be stored or loaded from.
* Loads tasks from the file specified by the path.
* This method reads each line from the file and parses the task information.
* Returns a list of Task objects.
* @return A list of Task objects loaded from the file.
* @throws FileNotFoundException if the file is not found.
* @throws GrimmException if the file format is invalid or corrupted.
public List<Task> load() throws FileNotFoundException, GrimmException {
* Saves a list of tasks to the file specified by the path.
* This method writes the tasks to the file in a format that can be reloaded later.
* @param tasks The list of tasks to save.
* @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs while writing to the file.
public void save(List<Task> tasks) throws IOException {

* @throws GrimmException if the input format is invalid or corrupted.

throw new GrimmException("The Troupe senses a corrupted file.Try again with: E,<0/1>,<desc>,<date>");

return "Nice! I've marked this task as done: \n" + task;

<AnchorPane maxHeight="-Infinity" maxWidth="-Infinity" minHeight="-Infinity" minWidth="-Infinity" prefHeight="600.0" prefWidth="400.0" stylesheets="@../css/main.css" xmlns="http://javafx.com/javafx/17.0.1" xmlns:fx="http://javafx.com/fxml/1" fx:controller="grimm.ui.MainWindow">
<TextField fx:id="userInput" layoutY="558.0" onAction="#handleUserInput" prefHeight="41.0" prefWidth="324.0" AnchorPane.bottomAnchor="1.0" AnchorPane.leftAnchor="0.0" AnchorPane.rightAnchor="76.0" />

<Button fx:id="sendButton" layoutX="324.0" layoutY="558.0" mnemonicParsing="false" onAction="#handleUserInput" prefHeight="41.0" prefWidth="76.0" text="Send" AnchorPane.bottomAnchor="1.0" AnchorPane.rightAnchor="0.0" />

<ScrollPane fx:id="scrollPane" fitToWidth="true" hbarPolicy="NEVER" hvalue="1.0" prefHeight="557.0" prefWidth="400.0" vvalue="1.0" AnchorPane.bottomAnchor="43.0" AnchorPane.leftAnchor="0.0" AnchorPane.rightAnchor="0.0" AnchorPane.topAnchor="0.0">

"[E][ ] Defeat NKG (from: 15 March 2024, 9:00 am to 15 March 2024, 9:30 am)",
"[E][X] Defeat NKG (from: 5 November 2024, 3:00 pm to 5 November 2024, 4:15 pm)",
Task t = new Task("Defeat Grimm", true);
assertFalse(t.getMark(), "New ToDo should not be marked by default");
ToDo t = new ToDo("Return book", true);
assertTrue(t.getMark(), "Constructor with true should mark the task");
ToDo t = new ToDo("Join the Troupe", false);
assertFalse(t.getMark(), "Constructor with false should leave task unmarked");
assertEquals("[T][ ] ", t.toString(), "Empty description should still format correctly");
